title: Taurasi DOCG
text:
Taurasi and Taurasi riserva are red, still <a href="Italian%20wines">Italian wines</a> based principally on the <a href="Aglianico">Aglianico</a> <a href="grape%20variety">grape variety</a> produced in the <a href="Province%20of%20Avellino">Province of Avellino</a> in the <a href="Campania">Campania</a> region. They were awarded "<a href="Denominazione%20di%20Origine%20Controllata">Denominazione di Origine Controllata</a>" (DOC) status in 1970 and "<a href="Denominazione%20di%20Origine%20Controllata%20e%20Garantita">Denominazione di Origine Controllata e Garantita</a>" (DOCG) status in 1993. Produced less than 40 miles (64 km) from the other Aglianico stronghold of <a href="Aglianico%20del%20Vulture">Aglianico del Vulture</a> in <a href="Basilicata">Basilicata</a>, the <a href="volcanic%20soil">volcanic soil</a>s of the Taurasi region demonstrate the potential the Aglianico grape has to make wines on par with the <a href="Nebbiolo">Nebbiolo</a> grape of <a href="Piedmont%20%28wine%29">Piedmont</a> and <a href="Sangiovese">Sangiovese</a> grape of <a href="Tuscany%20%28wine%29">Tuscany</a>. The popularity of the region's wine is a relatively recent phenomenon. Until the early 1990s, there was only one winery (<a href="Mastroberardino">Mastroberardino</a>), producing wine for the export market. By the mid-2000s, there were over 293 producers in the Taurausi zone.
Production zone.
The vineyards may be located within the boundaries of the following <a href="comuni">communes</a> of the <a href="Province%20of%20Avellino">Province of Avellino</a>: <a href="Taurasi">Taurasi</a>, <a href="Bonito%2C%20Campania">Bonito</a>, <a href="Castelfranci">Castelfranci</a>, <a href="Castelvetere%20sul%20Calore">Castelvetere sul Calore</a>, <a href="Fontanarosa">Fontanarosa</a>, <a href="Lapio">Lapio</a>, <a href="Luogosano">Luogosano</a>, <a href="Mirabella%20Eclano">Mirabella Eclano</a>, <a href="Montefalcione">Montefalcione</a>, <a href="Montemarano">Montemarano</a>, <a href="Montemiletto">Montemiletto</a>, <a href="Paternopoli">Paternopoli</a>, <a href="Pietradefusi">Pietradefusi</a>, <a href="Sant%27Angelo%20all%27Esca">Sant'Angelo all'Esca</a>, <a href="San%20Mango%20sul%20Calore">San Mango sul Calore</a>, <a href="Torre%20Le%20Nocelle">Torre Le Nocelle</a> and <a href="Venticano">Venticano</a>. The total area is about and is situated on <a href="volcanic">volcanic</a> soil.
Winemaking.
The Aglianico grape thrives on vineyards at higher altitudes, around 400 to 500 meters above <a href="sea%20level">sea level</a>. According to DOCG regulations, Taurasi wines must be aged a minimum of 3 years prior to release with at least 1 of those years being in <a href="oak%20%28wine%29">wood</a>. For wines labeled "Riserva", the wines must be aged for at least 4 years. The wines are made primarily from Aglianico though up to 15% of <a href="Barbera">Barbera</a>, <a href="Piedirosso">Piedirosso</a> and <a href="Sangiovese">Sangiovese</a> may be blended in.
